results.adx_keywords: Artificial Intelligence;Computers and the Internet;Research;Discrimination;Lemoine, Blake;Google Inc
results.byline: By Nico Grant and Cade Metz
results.title: Google Sidelines Engineer Who Claims Its A.I. Is Sentient
results.abstract: Blake Lemoine, the engineer, says that Google’s language model has a soul. The company disagrees.

media.caption: Some artificial intelligence researchers have made optimistic claims about technologies soon reaching sentience, but many others quickly dismiss those assertions.
media.copyright: Laura Morton for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Courts and the Judiciary;McFadden, Trevor N;Goodman, Eugene (1980- )
results.title: A man who carried a Confederate flag into the Capitol during the Jan. 6 attack goes on trial.
results.abstract: Kevin Seefried of Delaware was one of the first in a wave of pro-Trump rioters to breach the building where Congress was certifying electoral votes on Jan. 6, 2021.

media.caption: Kevin Seefried inside the Capitol building on Jan. 6, 2021. He goes on trial on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Gun Control;Mass Shootings;Constitutions;United States Politics and Government;Second Amendment (US Constitution);Australia;United States
results.title: What It Took for a Country With a Strong Gun Culture to Give Them Up
results.abstract: Australia’s success with gun reform was mostly a result of timing, luck and the idiosyncrasies of its Constitution. But it does hold important lessons for the U.S.

results.adx_keywords: Gun Control;Mass Shootings;Law and Legislation;United States Politics and Government;Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);Buffalo, NY, Shooting (May 14, 2022);Domestic Violence;Cornyn, John;Murphy, Christopher Scott;Senate
results.byline: By Emily Cochrane and Annie Karni
results.title: Senators Reach Bipartisan Deal on Gun Safety
results.abstract: The agreement, which falls short of the sprawling changes championed by Democrats, is a significant step toward ending a yearslong impasse over gun reform legislation.

media.caption: Senator Chuck Schumer of New York, the majority leader, pledged to put the agreement up for a vote once the legislation had been completed.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Embargoes and Sanctions;International Relations;Defense and Military Forces;United States International Relations;Foreign Aid;Putin, Vladimir V;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Bolsonaro, Jair (1955- );Russia;Africa;China;India;Brazil;Ukraine
results.byline: By Lara Jakes and Edward Wong
results.title: Biden Races to Expand Coalition Against Russia but Meets Resistance
results.abstract: Many Asian, African and Latin American nations are maintaining ties with Russia as the United States tries to isolate President Vladimir V. Putin and end the war in Ukraine.

media.caption: President Biden and President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil met on Thursday in Los Angeles. Brazil has continued to import fertilizer from Russia and Belarus, an ally of Moscow.
media.copyright: Samuel Corum for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Theater;Sexual Harassment;Sex Crimes;Movies;Television;Spacey, Kevin;Old Vic Theater;London (England)
results.title: London Police Charge Kevin Spacey With Sexual Assault
results.abstract: The actor will appear in a London court on Thursday to start what could be a lengthy trial process over multiple allegations of sexual assault.

media.caption: Kevin Spacey arriving to face a sexual assault charge at Nantucket District Court in Nantucket, Mass., in 2019. Prosecutors later dropped the case.

results.adx_keywords: United States Economy;Interest Rates;Inflation (Economics);Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Federal Reserve System;United States
results.title: The Fed May Discuss the Biggest Interest Rate Increase Since 1994
results.abstract: Central bankers had signaled that they would raise rates by half a point if data shaped up as expected. Inflation is instead running hotter.

media.caption: The Federal Reserve is set to release a fresh wave of economic projections on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.title: Best and Worst Moments of the 75th Tony Awards

media.caption: A 5-year-old received a dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine in Lansdale, Pa., in December.

results.title: How Covid Did Away With the Sick Day
results.abstract: Some workers have no choice but to clock in. Others find the flexibility of remote work leads them to log in from their sick beds.

results.title: 4 takeaways from Day 2 of the Jan. 6 hearings.
results.abstract: The big theme on the second day was that former President Trump was told repeatedly — including by his own attorney general — that his “big lie” about a fraudulent election was baseless.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: Representatives Bennie Thompson of Mississippi, Zoe Lofgren of California and Liz Cheney of Wyoming during Monday’s hearing.

results.title: The Hotel Is 642 Feet Tall. Its ‘Architect’ Says He Never Saw the Plans.
results.abstract: An architect lent his license to a New York City developer to approve buildings he didn’t design, according to an investigation by The New York Times.

media.caption: Marx Development Group is building a 51-story hotel in the Hudson Yards area of Manhattan and claims that a former employee, Warren L. Schiffman, designed it.

media.caption: Patients from the clinical trials, before and after 36 weeks of treatment with baricitinib.

results.title: U.S. Navy Plans ‘Safety Pause’ After Series of Aircraft Crashes
results.abstract: All non-deployed aircraft will stand down for one day to “review risk-management practices and conduct training,” the Navy said.

media.caption: The aircraft grounding on Monday comes after crashes within a seven-day period in California this month that resulted in six deaths.

results.abstract: Supply chain issues have hit tampons, and inflation has driven up prices. Here’s why there’s a shortage — and what you can do if you run out.

results.title: Ohio Makes It Easier for Teachers to Carry Guns at School
results.abstract: A new law requires educators and other school staff members who want to carry a weapon to undergo no more than 24 hours of training — compared with more than 700 hours previously.

media.caption: Video cameras monitoring the halls of Sidney High School in Sidney, Ohio.
